security: Revealing that a paroled Cuban is traveling under an alias with a falsified Argentine passport for TDY in South America could compromise ongoing operations, jeopardize the safety of the individual and reveal methods for clandestine travel.
summary: A memo discusses Miguel Angel DIAZ Isalgué, a paroled Cuban scheduled for TDY travel to Argentina under an alias, and requests for an Argentine passport with a B-2 visa and a reentry document to facilitate his travel.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET memorandum, dated April 5, 1968, from the Chief of the Alien Affairs Staff, concerns Miguel Angel DIAZ Isalgué, a paroled Cuban national born on February 14, 1937, in Matanzas, Cuba. Robert Fambrini of WH/4A reports that DIAZ Isalgué is scheduled for Temporary Duty (TDY) travel to Argentina using an alias. The memo notes that Fambrini is requesting a falsified Argentine passport with a B-2 visa for DIAZ Isalgué’s travel in South America and also an I-512 Reentry Document to allow DIAZ Isalgué to reenter the U.S. as a parolee upon his return.
title: Miguel Angel DIAZ Isalgué
